title: The Weavers - Greatest Hits (1986)
description:
This is the same torrent that was uploaded to Demonoid in September 2011.


The Weavers - Greatest Hits (1986)
 <a href="
http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/5123Z66NNXL._SL500_AA300_.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/5123Z66NNXL._SL500_AA300_.jpg</a>

Includes:
Files by track, ripped at FLAC 8 using Easy CD-DA Extractor (www.poikosoft.com) DVD-ROM: LG GDR816B
Tracks have full tags (including embedded thumbnail)
AMG Bio.txt
AMG Review.txt
info.txt (which is simply these notes included in the torrent)

First biography paragraph from All Music (by Bruce Eder):

The Weavers had the most extraordinary musical pedigree and pre-history of any performing group in the history of folk or popular music. More than 50 years after their heyday, however, their origins, the level of their success, the forces that cut the group's future off in its prime, and the allure that keeps their music selling are all difficult to explain -- as, indeed, none of this was all that easy to explain at the time. How could a song as pleasant and tuneful as "Kisses Sweeter Than Wine" be subversive?

Read all of the bio at: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-weavers-p2165/biography" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-weavers-p2165/biography</a>

All Music Album Review (by William Ruhlmann):

This is an excellent double-disc compilation of this group's more directly folk-related work from the mid 50s to the mid 60s. Note, however, that these are not the original Weavers recordings of their hits.

Taken from: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/album/greatest-hits-r97244" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/album/greatest-hits-r97244</a>

Amazon.com's page: <a href=" http://www.amazon.com/dp/B000000EBD" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.amazon.com/dp/B000000EBD</a>
